intro: Korthalsia zippelii var. aruensis, commonly known as the Aru korthalsia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Aru in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
